text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Sean a technical account
manager here at AWS based out of New
Hampshire
today I'm going to show you how to add
and verify a domain to use with Amazon
workmail let's get started
after logging into the AWS Management
console navigate to the workmail console
then select the organization that you
want to add a domain to
from here choose domains
choose add domain
enter the fully qualified domain name
that you want to add in the text box and
then choose add domain
now you see a list of items that must be
added to DNS to verify the domain
if the domain is using Amazon Route 53
you can automatically update the DNS
information by choosing the orange
update all in Route 53 button
if you aren't using Route 53 you must
manually copy the DNS record names and
values from the workmail console
then you must create the corresponding
DNS records in your DNS provider if you
aren't using Route 53 you also must
create some DNS records
doing this is important to configure
workmail verify domain ownership and
security
from the workmail console note the
record names and the values provided
create the corresponding DNS records
with this information in your DNS
provider
note it can take some time before the
changes become effective and your domain
is completely verified you can refresh
the page to see the current status
so now you know how to add and verify a
domain to use with workmail
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
